title: 104_hr3066
content: The Act "Native American Programs Amendments of 1996" establishes a Native American Community Development Financial Institution under Section 803A of the Native American Programs Act of 1974. The Commissioner shall make 1 grant to 1 eligible Hawaiian entity to establish and operate a Native Hawaiian community development financial institution for providing technical assistance and loans to Native Hawaiians for economic development in Hawaii. Eligibility requires submitting an application with an assurance of contributing capital from non-Federal sources. The Commissioner will grant funds to a Hawaiian entity to establish a Native Hawaiian community development financial institution. The entity must demonstrate the ability to operate successfully on a self-sustaining basis with capital from non-Federal sources. The grant will only be awarded to one eligible entity that can prove they will fulfill the specified purposes. The Native American Programs Act of 1974 is amended to include a definition of 'Hawaiian entity' as the Office of Hawaiian Affairs of the State of Hawaii, a Native Hawaiian organization, or the Office of Hawaiian Affairs of the State. The Native American Programs Act of 1974 is amended to include a definition of 'Native Hawaiian community development financial institution' as a person that qualifies as a community development financial institution and satisfies the requirements under the Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994. The Native American Programs Act of 1974 is amended to include a definition of 'Native Hawaiian organization' as a nonprofit organization controlled by Native Hawaiians, whose business activities will principally benefit Native Hawaiians. Repeal of Section 812 and amendment of Section 816 of the Native American Programs Act of 1974. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 1997 to 2001 totaling $35,000,000, with additional sums as needed. Effective date of the Act and amendments on October 1, 1996, with specific provisions for subsection (d) and transition for Section 803A.
